{"step_by_step_thinking": "Extracellular vesicles are small, membrane-bound particles that are released by cells into the extracellular environment. They are involved in a variety of biological processes, including intercellular communication, pathogenesis, and immune responses. Both Gram positive and Gram negative bacteria have been shown to release extracellular vesicles, although the mechanisms and functions may differ between the two groups.", "answer_choice": "A"}
